result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane M. Wellnitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane M. Wellnitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment plan granted in the amount of $25 per month commencing on 9/15 until paid in full

9:45. Defendant, Shane M. Wellnitz, in court with Atty Bradley J Jansen. Atty Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard. Atty Jansen heard. Atty Thompson heard. Court reviews PQ/WOR w/Deft, chrg + pnlts. Deft enters NC plea to Ct. 1. Court finds plea made f/vk/i, accepts plea and finds Deft guilty as charged. Atty Thompson heard. Atty Jansen heard. Statement by Deft. Court heard and ORDERS $500 + cc + domestic abuse surcharge.  To be paid at the rate of $25/mo commencing 9/15/16 or 30 days in DCJ as contempt sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

(previously posted)   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:36 - Defendant, Shane M. Wellnitz in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $150 Cash (as previously posted) bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
